snippet: Mitt Romney on Monday criticized President Obama’s policy and actions in the Middle East but avoided any endorsement of American military intervention.
abstract: News analysis; Mitt Romney, speaking at the Virginia Military Institute, launches broad attack against Pres Obama's policy and actions in the Middle East, but finds himself walking fine line between criticizing Obama and avoiding any endorsement of additional American military intervention.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Lexington, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Keene, Calif.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney on Monday criticized President Obama’s policy and actions in the Middle East but avoided any endorsement of American military intervention.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney Speaks Harshly but Treads Fine Line on Foreign Policy
headline.main: Romney Speaks Harshly but Treads Fine Line on Foreign Policy
headline.print_headline: Romney Speaks Harshly but Treads Fine Line on Foreign Policy

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
